name: Lodge on Loch Lomond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here during a recent trip to Scotland. We stayed in the main building, with a view onto the lake. We were pleasantly surprised with the sauna in the room.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - amazing views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was fantastic - the food and accommodation was great and well-priced. The maitre d's i the restaurant deserve particular praise - especially Luke, who was fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, excellent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel had amazing views and we were blessed with super weather. The hotel is A-standard, but to make it to A+, there are little things that could have been done better. For instance, on arrival, there was no help with the bags, and the reception did not really seem to have concierge style ability. Also, some of the maintenance of the hotel could have been more pristine than it was. However, these are minor quibbles - only needed to take the hotel from good to superb. We also thought the hotel a good price for the experience.
reviews.title: A very good quality restaurant with stunning views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a very beautiful hotel situated right on the Loch with its own private beach. We stayed just one night in the Munro room. The room was excellent with everything you could need and a very nice bathroom. I used the pool, spa and sauna and they were all very good. We didnt have dinner there as it was a minimum of £25 for 3 courses, however the breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Overnight Work Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not use the hotel. We had booked a meal there to catch up with my sister who lives in Glasgow while we were on our way to the Highlands.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a beautiful place! My son recently got married here and we had a wonderful day, evening and breakfast We also stayed here for a weekend before the wedding to "try it out" and we were very impressed with it overall (Watch out for Groupon deals!) The views from the restuarant and from all of the rooms is just unbeatable even on a dull day The scenery changes every hour
reviews.title: A room with a real view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding service and reception were inside with the panoramic views across the lodge from the floor to ceiling windows but the canapes and drinks were served on the lawn on the waterside Just lovely The photos are stunning!
reviews.title: Another relaxing stay at the Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coffee or lunch in the lounge in the luxury "sit in and sink in them sofas" is a treat and the staff are very polite, helpful and pleasant
reviews.title: Perfect Luxury Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a few problems with regards the wedding The remains of the wedding cake disappeared (almost half the £600 cake...seems strange as we saw it being taken into the kitchen at 12.30 that night) along with the specially engraved crystal knife Fortunately the knife turned up later but there is still no word on the cake four weeks later
reviews.title: Wonderful Relaxing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our friends were accused of not paying for their room which was a mistake They apologised but it was a bit embarassing
reviews.title: Relaxing,fantastic view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A one night stay cost us £240.40. Did not relise it was not bed & breakfast. £15 for a slice of toast & cup of tea.
reviews.title: one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very nice & helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was diffrent to say the least to many gadgets for my taste, I had to put my glasses on to read all the instructions to use the shower, basin, T.V. I gave up on the sauna.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing retreat!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning view over the Loch even though it was wet.
reviews.title: Stunning Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at! My husband and I stayed here for two nights dinner bed and breakfast and it could not have been better. From the moment of arrival we were greeted warmly by the friendly receptionist and we found all the staff to be very accommodating and lovely. We had a room in the main hotel and this was immaculate, we had a balcony and the sauna in the room was the icing on the cake. The pool was great and we were fortunate to have it to ourselves. Dinner was excellent on both nights and they had a deal on for three courses at £25, excellent value ! With plenty choices
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a few days in this lovely hotel. We had a Munro room which was spacious and very comfortable. There were a few things that we could pick at - curtains were tatty, no power point near the tea/coffee making facilities for instance - but the absolutely amazing views from the bed, sofa and balcony were to die for. The service everywhere was excellent and the food superb. All in all we had a fantastic stay and I would recommend it. If you go on a room only basis it is merely a few steps along the beach or footpath to the visitors' centre which offers breakfast at half the price, though again the views aren't as magnificent. We ate one night at the sister hotel Inverbeg Inn where the fish and chips were extremely good. For lunch or a snack you can't go wrong with the tea room in the converted village hall in Luss village. Also try the boat trip to Balmaha.
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its worth it to get a suite overlooking the lake. The hotel is at the prettiest part of the lake, across from the islands. Luss also is charming. The food was excellent. People are nice. The suite was very comfortable. What's not to like?
reviews.title: Incredible view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a cracking venue in a great location. The hotel Pool and Spa is very nice, when we stayed it was very quiet indeed.
reviews.title: Excellent Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was very good with a great range on offer.
reviews.title: lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The default Scottish Weather was the only negative aspect.
reviews.title: Great views, lovely hotel

description: The 4-star Lodge on Loch Lomond Hotel stands on a quiet sandy cove amid some of Scotland's most stunning scenery. With panoramic views of the Loch and mountains it offers a warm, relaxing atmosphere, delicious modern cuisine from the award winning 2 AA rosette restaurant Colquhoun's, stunning accommodation, including rooms with en-suite saunas and loch view private balconies, and a luxury health suite with spa and swimming pool. Perfectly located to explore Scotland, from cities to Highlands
